Description: Moulded and painted pottery female shabti with a black lappet-wig(worn), a modelled face, a yellow body(worn) with crossed arms in relief; the front of the leg section is inscribed with black painted Hieroglyphs(worn); the back is unshaped; the foot section has broken away.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
